sentences.english: These nagging injuries are things that Jordan never had to deal with.
sentences.chinese: 这些恼人的伤病，乔丹从未遇过。

sentences.english: No more of those annoying yellow question marks. Good riddance.
sentences.chinese: 再不会有恼人的黄色问号了，真是不错的解脱。

sentences.english: With the convenient and stylish Wireless Walkman say farewell to troublesome headphone cables.
sentences.chinese: 一款便利和时尚无线随身听，给恼人的耳机线说再见。

sentences.english: As I ran towards the crash, I heard the sickening sound of a horn, blowing constantly.
sentences.chinese: 我听到恼人的喇叭声，还响个不停。

sentences.english: Clutter is another scary thing for a lot of people.
sentences.chinese: 紊乱对很多人来说是另一件恼人的事情。

sentences.english: For some, it is an annoying distraction.
sentences.chinese: 对于某一部分人而言是恼人的干扰。

sentences.english: Of course, those taps were extremely bothersome.
sentences.chinese: 不过，这样的轻敲肯定是极其恼人的了。

sentences.english: Anti-Spam feature blocks annoying ad calls and SMSs.
sentences.chinese: 防垃圾邮件功能会阻止恼人的广告电话和手机简讯。

sentences.english: My sister fancies him, so it's very annoying.
sentences.chinese: 我的姐姐很迷恋他，这一点非常恼人。

sentences.english: He had an irritating habit of singing tunelessly about the house.
sentences.chinese: 他有个恼人的习惯，老在屋子里不成调地唱歌。

sentences.english: It turns out to be a far more irritating poem than its oft -quoted lines suggest.
sentences.chinese: 结果发现这首诗比起它常被引用的那几句来更加恼人。

sentences.english: The climate in my hometown is always pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 我家乡的气候总是恼人而舒爽。

sentences.english: It is annoying to is honest to no purpose.
sentences.chinese: 毫无意义地忠忠直直是恼人的事。

sentences.english: Lose of irritating hate, get it still surprised.
sentences.chinese: 失之恼人恨，得之还是惊。

sentences.english: The Book of Job is the most maddening of stories.
sentences.chinese: 我觉得约伯记是最恼人的故事集了。

sentences.english: He has the annoying habit of drumming the table with his finger tips.
sentences.chinese: 他有用手指尖敲桌子的恼人习惯。

definition: lit. heart distracted, thoughts in turmoil (idiom); distraught with anxiety
to feel agitated/to be troubled/to be annoyed/an upset or distraction
to feel vexed/to bother/to trouble/superfluous and confusing/edgy
unable to put up with (sth) any longer
to be vexed or annoyed/to feel queasy
